evidence: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) represents approximately 90% of these cases and affects 2–5% of all pregnancies and varies in direct proportion to type 2 diabetes mellitus in the background population.[1] Pre-existing diabetes mellitus complicates 0.2% to 0.3% of pregnancies.[2] The importance of diabetes in pregnancy stems from the fact that it carries a significant risk to both the foetus and the mother.
